page.title: 01EMLEY - GENERAL DESCRIPTION
page.content: Emley is a pleasant rural village, whose history dates back to Domesday 1086,when the Fitzwilliam family were Lords of the Manor of Emley. The present {LORD OF MANOR}George Halifax Lumley Savile,born 1919, is a batchelor and owns much of the land in Emley,(Savile Estates).100 years ago most people were employed at local collieries,on farms and in various village shops. Apart from a number of villagers employed at Park Mill Colliery(l2 years life left) Emley Moor colliery (closing November 1985)and at Waddingtons Printers, Clayton West, {THE MAJORITY WORK {OUTSIDE THE AREA.}During the last decade much{HOUSEBUILDING }has taken place for {PRIVATE OWNERSHIP.}The{ {POPULATION}is almost 1700,showing an increase of 400 since 1971.
